channel.title: Mommy Knows Best
channel.description: Jennifer Elam's online blog about being a mother, her observations of daily life, and her interactions with the products that are supposed to make it all better.

item.title: Tennessee Titans!
item.description:
A new study just came out about how larger families are happier¬†YAY! Finally support for the other side LOL! and not just large but 4 or more kiddos! My interest was peaked! Of course the caveat to this experiment is that these parents are happier because they planned a large family, had a large family, and then reaped the rewards of that big ass family‚Ä¶ J and I didn‚Äôt ever plan the ‚Äúparty of 6‚Äù so where are we on that happiness meter!?!

I‚Äôd say we‚Äôre getting there ;)

This move - the one back to our roots that speaks to my soul, the one that‚Äôs all ‚ÄúLean-In‚Äù to my role as a mom, really was a quit move. It¬†meant no school. It meant no career move. It meant no working my way up the cooperate ladder but who am I kidding, I hate climbing ;)

Surprisingly, it‚Äôs been a breath! A breath towards family, towards getting set-up and settled, towards fully embracing the fact that i‚Äôm a cookie baking, mommy cleaning, butt wiping machine. And the fun moments, the giggles and forts in bed and wide open adventures, those are all mine. My full plate.

So HI FROM TENNESSEE! Here we go!

item.title: wake up you need to make money!!!
item.description:
I‚Äôm looking at going back to school. While it‚Äôs been on the docket for awhile - ok, like a decade - I guess I need to get my big girl panties on and just get-er-done! Full Disclosure, even just typing the words ‚Äúgoing back to school‚Äù makes my stomach roll. Don‚Äôt get me wrong,

I truly loved the experience of college. The freedom on every level. Freedom to explore. Freedom to experiment. Freedom to experience. I LOVED THAT PART.

But the academics‚Ä¶ the memorization and the formidable exams. Failing when you really tried. Failing when you hoped for luck. Failure is just a bitch no matter how you skin it. ;) So, looking at going back to school now, minus ‚Äúthe experience‚Äù with a whole lotta -it‚Äôs not about the adventure, but pure academics mama!! Looking to gain knowledge and insight and to be honest, getting out there and makin some money! (how apt that a crazy rap song so perfectly fits this point in my life, ‚ÄúWAKE UP YOU NEED TO MAKE MONEY!!!‚Äù) ¬†- is all a little terrifying!

So, I‚Äôve got my liquid courage and I‚Äôm setting out on a new adventure starting now‚Ä¶¬†Wish me luck ;)

xoxo, Jen

item.title: Paddy's Day FAIL!
item.description:
Alright team, I‚Äôve tried! GOD KNOWS I‚ÄôVE TRIED! I‚Äôve embraced staying at home. I continue to remind myself that I chose to do this. I CHOOSE THIS LIFE! So WHY!! WHHHHHYYYYY friends am I stuck in a hot kitchen with the smell of burnt chocolate all around me miserably trying to smoosh M&Ms into hard angry won‚Äôt-melt-AT-ALL! treats for Harley‚Äôs preschool snack! WHY???

These are the adorable pics - The Pinterest ‚Äúit‚Äôs so easy‚Äù pics.

Now these are my creations -

OHHHH ladies WHY!?!?!?!?

On the bright side, these were my testers. ¬†So I have 3 more days until I throw in the towel and head to the store to get green frosted sugar cookies but I‚Äôm trying (there‚Äôs points for that right?)

Happy Monday y‚Äôall!

xoxo, Jen

item.title: OHHHH the places we'll go!
item.description:
I watched a video the other day that was so moving, it actually moved me right off the couch to go and find our old copy of Dr. Seuss‚Äôs OH, the Places You‚Äôll GO!

The vid was a dad giving his now college bound daughter a book that he had passed around since her early kinder days. He asked each teacher/coach/friend to write something memorable so that by the time she had graduated high school it was invariably a year book to span years! I was so moved by the heartfelt gift that my heart just went splat! So ran out - I told you it got me moving - and purchased 3 more books. I‚Äôve done some digging and pieced together this little poem:

Dear Teacher, very grateful to you I would be,
if you would please, please do this favor for me.
I‚Äôm starting this gift when Ima is small,
and plan to complete it by the time she is tall.
Each teacher who helps her along the way,
I hope will autograph ‚Äìthat is to say-
Please add a note, a picture or song,
A special memory can never be wrong.
You have helped make her the person she is
and you can take credit when they call her a whiz!

It‚Äôs early - I actually haven‚Äôt gotten all of our kiddos books back from our first run through, but I wanted to share! If you can do it - especially for families who move around - it‚Äôs a great way to keep those special moments for your kiddos ;)

mommyknowsbest seal of approval!

xoxo, Jen

item.title: The Great Wall
item.description:
I feel like walls have been all the rage lately. Trump says build a wall. The Vatican says they don‚Äôt wall, but it sure looks like they‚Äôre snugged in tight with some pretty wide margins‚Ä¶¬†Anyways, today it‚Äôs me who needs the wall. I went to run errands with the littles and totally pissed off complete strangers! HOW IS THAT POSSIBLE!?! I literally walked from place to place, doing my business, only to look up and see scowls! grumpy faces! smiles that were absolutely NOT returned! I emailed a trainer for our dog and ended up in a pissing match about who had more to do!

So, here it is - we‚Äôre all trying to make it and IT‚ÄôS HARD! It‚Äôs sooo much harder than I ever thought! But I know you‚Äôre out there fighting to get yourself together and your kids in a better place! I think we all need to throw out alittle love and support today! Here‚Äôs mine!

Go out and make it a kick ass Monday! üòòüòòüòòüòçüòçüòçüëèüëè

Xoxo, Jen

item.title: Shoe Tying 101
item.description:
Resources and opportunity mamas! That is really what it comes down to when you have kiddos. Let‚Äôs be honest, it‚Äôs hard to find great teaching tools, a fun environment and not gasp at the sticker shock‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs why I had to share this shoe tying class offered by Nordstrom (yep the fancy store that gives away balloons!) They offer a class once a month for kiddos to learn to bunny year with the best of ‚Äòem. Not only did we learn to tie (something I‚Äôve been trying to teach my 7 year old for MONTHS!) but we walked away with a little ‚ÄúI DID IT!‚Äù certificate, a goody bag packed with cute kiddo yummies and a discount on kids shoes! all completely free!¬†It was fantastic! WE skipped out of there with HUGE smiles - Me not believing how great it all turned out and Ima with a renewed confidence, sucking a lollipop and holding her balloon wearing her just laced sneakers!

Definitely gets the mommyknowsbest seal of approval!

Happy Weekend! Jen@mommyknowsbest.co

item.title: I'm gellin'
item.description:
I absolutely love my GelPro mat!¬†We use one in the kitchen and another in the laundry. I can‚Äôt say enough about the back aches these little wonders have saved me from! The gel core has been proven to reduce fatigue and stress on joints so spaces where¬†I‚Äôm standing for long¬†periods of time i.e. the stove and the washing machine (you would feint at the multitude of laundry it takes to keep us running) - are a welcome relief! Love! Love! Love!

xoxo, jen@mommyknowsbest.co

item.title: Motherhood - nailing it!!
item.description:
I love this! There are so many days where I feel like the pressure to not only have a great day but to have the most stupendous day! Where the kids are learning and growing and have everything they could possibly need - met at the exact time they could need it! - is SUCH a huge weight! So today, maybe shift that perspective and say YEP! NAILED IT!

Xoxo, jen@mommyknowsbest.co

item.title: mommyknowsbest.co
item.description:
My parents are in town‚Ä¶ Does anyone else not get a thing done with family in town!!!?!? It‚Äôs such a blessing to have them come up. We don‚Äôt have live-in or even live-close grandparents so to have visiting-loving grandparents that are not only willing to take the kids but enjoy them while they‚Äôre out! - it‚Äôs a game changer almost enough to make us want to move closer :)

Anyway, they have a way of throwing off my game ;/ so much that it‚Äôs hard to even check in with mommyknowsbest.co. So, if you‚Äôve been wondering if I fell off the face of the earth - I‚Äôm here! For you! For me, really, as this is basically helping to realign my sanity !!!! But I‚Äôm here. What‚Äôs new?

xoxo, Jen

item.title: Fell in love
item.description:
I love this - and not just for it‚Äôs obvious meaning of putting the phone down and dialing into what ever is¬†in front of you - but for the explicit purpose of taking a breath, a minute, an instant to just be! It can be a thankful minute. A minute that you‚Äôre reading this and you give thanks that you are healthy, you have a roof over your head and clothes for you and your kids or maybe you‚Äôre not healthy. Maybe you‚Äôre suffering and dragging around a burden that is unseen but continues to weigh on you still. Either way, take a second to find your positive. To give yourself a pat on the back for getting up this morning and taking a step forward! Unplug for a second and look at those babies in front of you‚Ä¶

Xoxo, Jen
